segment.source: robstack - V2 of Alerts docs
segment.target: robstack - V2 of Alerts docs

segment.source: robstack - V2 of Alerts docs
segment.target: robstack - V2 of Alerts docs

segment.source: Alerts keep you in touch with what's happening in .
segment.target: Alerts keep you in touch with what's happening in .

segment.source: For example, alerts can notify you about the following events:
segment.target: For example, alerts can notify you about the following events:

segment.source: There is a problem with the Exchange Connector which affects mobile device management
segment.target: There is a problem with the Exchange Connector which affects mobile device management

segment.source: Malware has been found on a computer
segment.target: Malware has been found on a computer

segment.source: A conflict between two policies has been detected
segment.target: A conflict between two policies has been detected

segment.source: The latest updates and information about the service (notices).
segment.target: The latest updates and information about the service (notices).

segment.source: How alerts work
segment.target: How alerts work

segment.source: Alerts are generated based on alert types, a set of preconfigured rules built into .
segment.target: Alerts are generated based on alert types, a set of preconfigured rules built into .

segment.source: For example, the alert type Cloud storage has 10% or less free space alerts you when you are running out of space to store your apps in the cloud.
segment.target: For example, the alert type Cloud storage has 10% or less free space alerts you when you are running out of space to store your apps in the cloud.

segment.source: You can enable or disable, and configure properties for each alert type, for example, using the above alert type, you can configure:
segment.target: You can enable or disable, and configure properties for each alert type, for example, using the above alert type, you can configure:

segment.source: State: Whether this alert type is enabled or disabled
segment.target: State: Whether this alert type is enabled or disabled

segment.source: Severity: How serious is this alert?
segment.target: Severity: How serious is this alert?

segment.source: Severity
segment.target: Severity

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Indicates a serious issue that you should investigate as soon as possible, for example, if malware has been detected on a computer.
segment.target: Indicates a serious issue that you should investigate as soon as possible, for example, if malware has been detected on a computer.

segment.source: Indicates an issue that is not currently serious, but might become serious if you do not attend to it, for example, security updates are waiting to be installed.
segment.target: Indicates an issue that is not currently serious, but might become serious if you do not attend to it, for example, security updates are waiting to be installed.

segment.source: Indicates information that is not critical to your operations, for example, a new version of the Exchange Connector is available.
segment.target: Indicates information that is not critical to your operations, for example, a new version of the Exchange Connector is available.

segment.source: Other alert types might contain different items you can configure such as the percentage of devices that must be affected by an issue before an alert is generated.
segment.target: Other alert types might contain different items you can configure such as the percentage of devices that must be affected by an issue before an alert is generated.

segment.source: When the criteria in an alert type is met, an alert is generated and displayed in the admin console.
segment.target: When the criteria in an alert type is met, an alert is generated and displayed in the admin console.

segment.source: Additionally, you can configure to notify you by email when an alert is generated.
segment.target: Additionally, you can configure to notify you by email when an alert is generated.

segment.source: Configuring alerts
segment.target: Configuring alerts

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Alerts and Notifications, then choose one of the following configuration tasks:
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Alerts and Notifications, then choose one of the following configuration tasks:

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Alert Types
segment.target: Alert Types

segment.source: Choose the alert type you want to configure, then do one of the following:
segment.target: Choose the alert type you want to configure, then do one of the following:

segment.source: - Click Configure.
segment.target: - Click Configure.

segment.source: In the Configure Alert Type dialog box, configure the settings you want, then click OK.
segment.target: In the Configure Alert Type dialog box, configure the settings you want, then click OK.

segment.source: - Enable or Disable the alert.
segment.target: - Enable or Disable the alert.

segment.source: Tip: Expand the Alert Types node and click a category to view only the alert types in that category.
segment.target: Tip: Expand the Alert Types node and click a category to view only the alert types in that category.

segment.source: Recipients
segment.target: Recipients

segment.source: Click Add to add a new email address that will receive the email notifications you configure.
segment.target: Click Add to add a new email address that will receive the email notifications you configure.

segment.source: You can also Edit or Delete existing recipients.
segment.target: You can also Edit or Delete existing recipients.

segment.source: Tip: To receive notifications, you must also add this email address as a recipient under Notification Rules.
segment.target: Tip: To receive notifications, you must also add this email address as a recipient under Notification Rules.

segment.source: Notification Rules
segment.target: Notification Rules

segment.source: Configures rules that define who an email alert will be sent to.
segment.target: Configures rules that define who an email alert will be sent to.

segment.source: You can either:
segment.target: You can either:

segment.source: Choose an existing rule - Choose a rule, then click Select Recipients.
segment.target: Choose an existing rule - Choose a rule, then click Select Recipients.

segment.source: You can then select all recipients who will receive an email when an alert that fulfills this rule is generated.
segment.target: You can then select all recipients who will receive an email when an alert that fulfills this rule is generated.

segment.source: Create a new rule - Click Create New Rule, then:
segment.target: Create a new rule - Click Create New Rule, then:

segment.source: Enter a name for the rule, then select the alert categories and alert severity that apply to the rule.
segment.target: Enter a name for the rule, then select the alert categories and alert severity that apply to the rule.

segment.source: Select the device groups that the rule applies to.
segment.target: Select the device groups that the rule applies to.

segment.source: Select the users who will receive an email when an alert is generated.
segment.target: Select the users who will receive an email when an alert is generated.

segment.source: Click Save.
segment.target: Click Save.

segment.source: You can also Enable, Disable, Edit, or Delete an existing rule.
segment.target: You can also Enable, Disable, Edit, or Delete an existing rule.

segment.source: Working with alerts
segment.target: Working with alerts

segment.source: Use the following options to help you work with alerts from the Intune admin console.
segment.target: Use the following options to help you work with alerts from the Intune admin console.

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: View active alerts
segment.target: View active alerts

segment.source: Choose one of:
segment.target: Choose one of:

segment.source: - View an alert summary - In the Dashboard workspace, the top errors are displayed in the Alerts pane.
segment.target: - View an alert summary - In the Dashboard workspace, the top errors are displayed in the Alerts pane.

segment.source: Click the pane to see more detailed information.
segment.target: Click the pane to see more detailed information.

segment.source: Additionally, you can view an alert summary on the Overview page of the Alerts workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, you can view an alert summary on the Overview page of the Alerts workspace.

segment.source: - View all alerts - In the Alerts workspace, click All Alerts.
segment.target: - View all alerts - In the Alerts workspace, click All Alerts.

segment.source: View notices
segment.target: View notices

segment.source: Choose one of:
segment.target: Choose one of:

segment.source: - In the Dashboard workspace, click Notices.
segment.target: - In the Dashboard workspace, click Notices.

segment.source: - In the Alerts workspace, click All Alerts > Notices.
segment.target: - In the Alerts workspace, click All Alerts > Notices.

segment.source: Close an alert
segment.target: Close an alert

segment.source: In the list of alerts, choose the alert to close, then click Close Alert.
segment.target: In the list of alerts, choose the alert to close, then click Close Alert.

segment.source: Closed alerts are permanently deleted after 90 days.
segment.target: Closed alerts are permanently deleted after 90 days.

segment.source: Reactivate a closed alert
segment.target: Reactivate a closed alert

segment.source: In the list of alerts, set the Filters drop-down to Closed.
segment.target: In the list of alerts, set the Filters drop-down to Closed.

segment.source: In the list of closed alerts, select the alert you want to reactivate, then click Reactivate Alert.
segment.target: In the list of closed alerts, select the alert you want to reactivate, then click Reactivate Alert.

segment.source: alerts remain active until:
segment.target: alerts remain active until:

segment.source: The issue that caused the alert is resolved
segment.target: The issue that caused the alert is resolved

segment.source: You manually close the alert
segment.target: You manually close the alert

segment.source: 45 days have passed since the alert was generated
segment.target: 45 days have passed since the alert was generated

segment.source: If the same alert is generated by devices that run different operating systems, you might see multiple versions of the same alert in the alerts list.
segment.target: If the same alert is generated by devices that run different operating systems, you might see multiple versions of the same alert in the alerts list.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
